intro: Corallodendron acanthocarpum, commonly known as the spiny-fruited corallodendron, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree characterized by its woody stems and dense, often thorny foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by distinctive, spiny fruits. Its leaves are usually opposite, simple, and have a leathery texture. Corallodendron acanthocarpum is adapted to dry or semi-arid environments and is often found in savanna or woodland habitats.
